attributes.action: Rethink the Mental Health Bill currently going through Parliament, as the new powers are potential weapons of misuse
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This bill will allow wrongful forced treatment of people who are labelled by others as 'mentally ill'.

The use of these powers could be influenced by prejudice, racism or other varients of discrimination.

They are a likely weapon of misuse against minorities and innocent sufferers of mental conditions, by doctors and police as they see fit.

BBC News has suggested that some people will avoid making doctors appointments for fear that they might be detained simply because of their illness and not knowing when or if they will be released.

A petition based on this matter has already been rejected on the grounds of 'unauthorised mention of a web site'. 

This text has no such grounds for rejection and for the sake of extremely valuable human rights the public should unite against this bill.
